text:
- You've likely been through
some painful experiences
that leave a deep imprint on your emotions
and psyche some experiences cut so deep

that your mind instinctively
shields you locking away

memories so painful they become
ghosts haunting your present

a phenomenon we may call
emotional amnesia emotional

amnesia is a defense mechanism
against overwhelming emotions
associated with a triggering

and traumatic memory unlike
general amnesia which primarily
in affects factual

or autobiographical memories
left unaddressed this trauma
response can ultimately lead

to greater emotional
dysregulation even longer
after the traumatic event has passed

that said let's explore
some important warning signs

that someone is affected by
emotional amnesia according

to experts memory fragmentation
one of the primary signs
of emotional amnesia is the fragmentation
of emotional memories according

to psychiatrist Dr Nicole
Washington traumatic events can

create emotional black holes
wherein specific details

and emotions associated with
the event become inaccessible

or forgotten this selective
memory loss often occurs
as a protective mechanism

to shield us from the extremely
painful emotions connected

to the trauma so if there
are certain periods of time
or things you're sure happen
but have no memory of it may be a sign

that you have emotional amnesia
avoidance behaviors much

like PTSD trauma-induced
emotional amnesia lead us

to develop avoidance behaviors
says psychologist Dr Matthew

tall we may begin to
unconsciously steer clear

of certain places people or
situations that trigger memories

or past trauma for example
a person who's been in a car

accident might find
themselves avoiding driving

or even being in a car altogether
this avoidance is a coping

mechanism to shield ourselves
from the overwhelming emotions

and distress that
resurface when confronted
with traumatic reminders

but while they may offer
temporary relief they can also
impede our ability to heal
and process the emotions tied

to the traumatic event
emotional numbing have you ever

experienced a traumatic event
that's left you with a sense

of emotional detachment
ever since this difficulty

connecting with one's
feelings is common in people

with emotional amnesia clinical
psychologist Dr Sabrina

Romanov explains that emotional
numbing is another way
for the mind to cope with the intensity
of the traumas emotional impact as well
as the associated grief depression anxiety
and stress allowing yourself

to feel all these things at
once is understandably too hard

for some people to do
disassociation disassociation is

another central symptom of
emotional amnesia says clinical

social worker jason jelinek
people who cope with trauma
through forgetting may experience a sense

of detachment from reality as
if they're living on autopilot

or observing their lives
from outside their bodies

and while this does help them
distance themselves from the
emotional distress associated

with the traumatic memories
it also hinders their ability

to process the trauma engaged
fully in the present moment
and for meaningful connections
with others re-experiencing flashbacks
- Have you ever seen the movie the perks

of being a wallflower if
not then this is a bit
of a spoiler alert you may want

to skip ahead a few
seconds still there okay
so at the climax of the film it's revealed

that the main character Charlie
is suffering from emotional
amnesia and experiences flashbacks
of his aunt assaulting him according

to psychologist Dr Tiffany
Taft it's common for victims
of trauma to experience sudden

and overwhelming emotional
surges which can be triggered
even by things seemingly unrelated

to the traumatic event these
vivid emotional recollections
even without the full recall

of specific details highlight
the power of emotional memory

and its profound influence
in a person's mental
and emotional well-being so psych to goers

with everything you've learned
from this video do you think

suppressing painful memories
really shields us from trauma's

impact or does it trap us in
its emotional Echoes tell us
your thoughts in the comments down below

if you found this video
helpful don't forget to like

and subscribe to we also made
a video on seven signs you're

not a bad person it's your
trauma if you're interested in

learning more about this
topic reflecting on the

significance of emotional
amnesia encourages us
to delve into human resilience
and the potential

for transformative healing
when confronting our deepest

emotional wounds by taking
the steps to address
and overcome our past trauma we can begin

to journey towards inner
healing and emotional growth
